gov.sandia.cognition.graph

Interface DirectedWeightedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>

  • Type Parameters:
    NodeNameType - The type used to specify nodes
    All Superinterfaces:
    DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    WeightedDenseMemoryGraph

    public interface DirectedWeightedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>
extends DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>
    Adds the necessary methods for a graph with weighted edges.
    Author:
    jdwendt

      • Methods inherited from interface gov.sandia.cognition.graph.DirectedNodeEdgeGraph

        addNode, clear, containsNode, getEdgeEndpointIds, getNode, getNodeId, getNodes, getNumEdges, getNumNodes, getSuccessors

    • Method Detail

      • addEdge

        void addEdge(NodeNameType left,
             NodeNameType right)
        Adds a directed edge from left to right. If left and right are not already in the graph, they are added before the edge is added. NOTE: Calling this method results in an edge with 1.0 weight.
        Specified by:
        addEdge in interface DirectedNodeEdgeGraph<NodeNameType>
        Parameters:
        left - The source of the edge
        right - The destination of the edge

      • addEdge

        void addEdge(NodeNameType left,
             NodeNameType right,
             double weight)
        Adds a directed edge from left to right with the input weight. If left and right are not already in the graph, they are added before the edge is added.
        Parameters:
        left - The source of the edge
        right - The destination of the edge
        weight - The weight to assign this edge

      • getSuccessorsWithWeights

        java.util.Collection<Pair<NodeNameType,java.lang.Double>> getSuccessorsWithWeights(NodeNameType node)
        Returns all the nodes this node connects to with edge weights (outgoing edges only).
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose successors and weights are wanted
        Returns:
        all the nodes this node connects to.

      • getEdgeWeight

        double getEdgeWeight(int id)
        This returns the weight of edge id (where id is [0 ... numEdges())). Note that the ids for edges are not necessarily fixed across calls to addEdge (as edge ordering can change due to insertion of new edges).
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the edge whose weight is desired
        Returns:
        The weight for edge id
